required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Two Different Digital Methods in Occlusal Analysis
clinical_study.official_title: COMPARISON OF SENTRIC OCCLUSION DATA OBTAINED FROM TWO DIFFERENT COMPUTER-ASSISTED RECORDING METHODS

brief_summary.textblock:
Aim: The aim of this study is to compare the T-Scan digital occlusal analysis system and the occlusal analysis mode of the CEREC Omnicam system, which is mainly used for design/ production, using the data recorded at the centric occlusion position.
Material-Method: Occlusal recordings were obtained from healthy 20 females and 20 males aged 18-25 at the centric occlusion position. Records were saved as .jpeg format and transferred to Adobe Photoshop CS6 program. Blue, green, and red colors (shown by the same color codes in both systems) representing light, intense and tight contacts, respectively, were evaluated in terms of the pixel counts. For statistical comparison the differences between the systems Independent Sample T-Test and, between the genders, One Sample T- Test were used (α = 0.05).

primary_outcome.measure: Comparing the levels of accuracy of the occlusal analysis mode included in the software of CEREC Omnicam and the T-Scan occlusal analysis system.
primary_outcome.description: In both systems, the data of contact intensity were defined with a color scale of blue to red where blue showed the lowest intensity and red the highest. The contact area images obtained from both systems were recorded in .jpeg format and were then transferred to the Adobe Photoshop CS6 program (Adobe Systems, USA) for comparisons to be made. The number of pixels in the contact areas of the upper and lower jaws of each subject in all the recordings obtained with the T-Scan and CEREC Omnicam systems were determined using the Adobe Photoshop CS6 pixel-based photographic procedure program.

intervention.description: Occlusal contact recordings of all the teeth were obtained digitally under conditions of maximum bite force and centric occlusion only with the T-Scan (T-Scan III, version 9.1, Tekscan Inc., South Boston, USA).

intervention.intervention_name: Digital Occlusal Recording with Cerec Omnicam
intervention.description: Occlusal contact recordings of all the teeth were obtained digitally under conditions of maximum bite force and centric occlusion only with the CEREC Omnicam™ (version 4.2, Sirona Dental Systems, New York, USA).

study_pop.textblock: The groups were formed of voluntary participants from undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Dentistry Faculty of Gazi University.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Individuals with no missing teeth (teeth numbers 18, 28, 38, 48 were excluded from the evaluation), no local or systemic disorders that could prevent the bite, and no disorder determined as a result of the TMJ examination.
Exclusion Criteria:
-

eligibility.gender_description: A total of 20 males and 20 females were included in the study, all aged 18-25 years, with no missing teeth (teeth numbers 18, 28, 38, 48 were excluded from the evaluation), no local or systemic disorders that could prevent the bite, and no disorder determined as a result of the TMJ examination.

overall_official.last_name: Evsen TAMAM, Phd, DDS, Assoc Prof Dr

patient_data.ipd_description: It is planned to publish all the collected data as an article in a well-known journal.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: The study has already been prepared to submit to a journal. It is requested to be published on condition that it is accepted.
